titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Vahac Mardirosian papers, 1964-2007 LSC.1887
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Yasmin Damshenas in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), with assistance from Kelley Wolfe Bachli and Megan Hahn Fraser, December 2011; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of this collection was generously supported by Arcadia funds.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-26 15:04:49 -0700.

physdesc.extent: (7 document boxes and 1 half document box)

did.abstract: Reverend Vahac Mardirosian has been a major advocate of Mexican-American educational reforms in Los Angeles and San Diego school districts since the early 1960s. This collection contains material related to his pastoral work, his involvement with the 1968 East Los Angeles walk-out demonstration and organizations he helped found and run, including the Hispanic Urban Center Board of Education (founded 1970) and Parent Institute for Quality Education (founded 1987). Materials include clippings and press releases, letters and statements, notes, sermons, evaluation reports, reading score percentiles and rankings, memoranda, fact sheets and administrative documents, and cover a wide variety of educational topics including bilingual education, integration, teachers' attitudes towards Mexican American students, parental involvement, and reading achievement.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Vahac Mardirosian papers (Collection 1887). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of Caliofnria, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: Processed by Yasmin Damshenas in the Center for Primary Research and Training (CFPRT), with assistance from Kelley Wolfe Bachli and Megan Hahn Fraser, December 2011.
The processing of this collection was generously supported by Arcadia funds.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Reverend Vahac Mardirosian has been a leading advocate of educational reform in Southern California, especially in the Mexican American communities, since the late 1960s. Of Armenian descent, he was born in Alepo, Syria and raised in Mexico City and Tijuana. He became ordained as a Baptist priest in California in 1946 and went on to serve the Mexican American communities of Topeka and Chicago, before returning to California in the 1950s. In 1968 he became involved with the walk-out protests at Garfield High School in the East Los Angeles School District. He acted as a mediator with administrators and became a representative of parents and students in his role as chairman of the Educational Issues Coordinating Committee (EICC).

He founded and acted as executive director of the Hispanic Urban Center in Los Angeles in 1970, which focused on in-service education for teachers, seeking to enhance their perceptions of Mexican American culture and improve teacher/student relations. In 1987 Mardirosian started the Parent Institute for Quality Education (PIQE) to address underperforming schools in the San Diego School District in response to concerned parents. PIQE offers a 9-week program to help improve education through the joint collaboration of parents, students and teachers and emphasizes the role of parents as advocates for their children. In 2006 California State University (CSU) began working with PIQE to provide funding and support of outreach and training for low-income families.

In 1988 Mardirosian received recognition from Phi Delta Kappa for his service and leadership in educational reform and in 1998 CSU awarded him an honorary doctorate for his impact on the lives of parents and children of California. In 2010 Mardirosian received the "Remarkable Leader in Education" award from the University of San Diego.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains material related to Vahac Mardirosian's pastoral work, his involvement with the 1968 East Los Angeles walk-out demonstration and the organizations he helped found and run, including the Hispanic Urban Center Board of Education and the Parent Institute for Quality Education. Materials include clippings, press releases, letters, statements, notes, sermons, evaluation reports, reading score percentiles and rankings, memoranda, fact sheets, and administrative documents, and cover a wide variety of educational topics including bilingual education, integration, teachers' attitudes towards Mexican American students, parental involvement, and reading achievement.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Pastoral Work
East Los Angeles High School Walk Out
Hispanic Urban Center Board of Education
Parent Institute for Quality Education (PIQE)
Biographical Materials

p.extref: UCLA: Chicano Studies Research Center Library, Collection 56, The Desegregation Collection:

list.item: Box 6C, Folder 183, Vahac Mardirosian. "Los Angeles City Schools Sixth Grade Fall 1971 Reading Scores." L.A Unified School District Summary Report #321.
Box 6D, Folder 212, "Los Angeles City Schools." Chart Prepared by Vahac Mardirosian. Also, "Letter to Mr. Vahac Mardirosian." 15 Apr. 1977.

p.extref: Stanford University Special Collections, Collection M0673, Mexican American Legal Defense and Educational Fund:

list.item: RG 5, Box 1105, Folder 8, Mardirosian, Vahac Rev. Part of the Los Angeles alphabetical case files.

controlaccess.corpname: Hispanic Urban Center Board of Education

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mostly VM's handwritten notes and sermons, as well as some typescript notes on a variety of materials including notebook paper, index cards and the back of ephemera. Most tend to be undated. Majority of sermons labeled with biblical references. Also, typescript draft of Mardirosian's "Our Cultural Heritage and the Gospel," and programs, letters, clippings and periodicals, minutes for Ad Hoc Advisory Committee on Theological Education for Hispanic-Americans, and report of Baptist Hispanic Causcus.

did.unittitle: East Los Angeles High School Walk Out

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, statements made by VM, memoranda, letters, notes, leaflets, press releases, and drafts. In addition to the 1968 walk out, topics include the Mexican American Education Commission, death of Ruben Salazar, profile of Cesar Chavez, youth leadership and community development project, chapter VM wrote on "Planning for Effective Schools," 1969 sit-in demonstration, and actions taken by Board of Education.

did.unittitle: Inter-Religious Goals Committee memoranda and suggestions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda. Suggested elements for the Goals Council Report.

did.unittitle: Copies of flyer for meeting of educational issues committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters written in response to newspaper editorials on East Los Angeles education issue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet, copy of "Con Safos" magazine, flyers and information sheets, contact list, clippings, meeting minutes, letters received, notes, and poems. Includes information on student demands, indicted instructors, a police riot at Roosevelt High School.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Press releases, clippings, map of march route from Placita Park to Board of Education, meeting program, fact sheet on Roosevelt High School, letter received, financial report, handwritten notes, statements made by VM to Board of Education.

did.unittitle: Reprinted profile on Chavez from the New Yorker by Peter Mathiessen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet, press release, newsletter clippings, flyers, Board of Education member list. Topics include the Mexican American Education Commission and reading scores and programs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript chapter by VM on "Planning for Effective Schools" and a 2005 account by VM of a sit-in at the D.A.'s office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings and handwritten notes about walkout and its aftermath. Also, letters received, VM's statements to Board of Education, meeting minutes of Educational Issue Coordination Committee (EICC), and teacher proposals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, minutes, draft and notes re: Board of Education & Urban Affairs meeting, student demands, indictment of participants, statements by VM, demonstration at Lincoln High School, bilingual education, sit-in at the School Board, interview with VM.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Meeting minutes of Educational Issue Coordination Committee (EICC), clippings and notes re: Spanish language programs, creation of citizen units, studies on education, ethnic makeup of Urban Affairs and Housing Committee members, demonstrations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Re: prejudice charges against Lincoln High instructor, School Board meetings and decisions, bilingual education, Mexican American Education Commission, reading programs, reform bill on teacher licensing, report card elimination proposal, integration.

scopecontent.p: Includes progress reports, program proposals, clippings, leaflets, letters, school visit commentary, fact sheets, L.A. school sample lists and reading scores, press release for VM's candidacy as school board member (District 5), photographs.
